description: From Middle English disclaimen, from Anglo-Norman disclaimer, from Old French desclamer (French d√©clamer), des- + clamer.

verbs.description: disclaim (third-person singular simple present disclaims, present participle disclaiming, simple past and past participle disclaimed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To renounce all claim to; to deny ownership of or responsibility for; to disown; to disavow; to reject.
examples: He disclaims the authority of Jesus.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To deny, as a claim; to refuse.
examples: The payment was irregularly made, if not disclaimed.

entries.meaning: (intransitive, transitive) (law) To relinquish or deny having a claim; to disavow another's claim; to decline accepting, as an estate, interest, or office.
(transitive) To make an admission or warning.
